title: British Gas engineers start five-day strike over pay and conditions
lead: GMB union said it is the ‘first national gas strike in a decade’

title: Smarter Grid Solutions appointed to project to help free up grid capacity for clean power
lead: The firm has been appointed Active Network Management partner for the innovative QUEST project, which is expected to save networks more than £250m

title: Fossil fuel divestment could be shifting finance into ‘pollution havens’
lead: The University of Edinburgh Business School warns that some domestic banks in countries with strict environmental policies are simply shifting their fossil fuel spending abroad

title: UK summer heatwaves projected to soar 50% higher than global average
lead: A new study warns the country could face a ‘future of extreme heatwaves’, carrying with it a raft of serious health risks

title: Scientists develop material that harvests human sweat to power electronic devices
lead: The novel film absorbs moisture from the sweat and working as an electrolyte turns it into energy

title: BEV and PHEV registrations in UK hit record highs in 2020
lead: Battery and plug-in hybrid electric vehicles together accounted for more than one-in-ten registrations, according to a new report

title: Almost 700 people evacuate their flats after ‘major incident’ with gas leak in Crawley
lead: A ‘significant’ leak of natural gas had reportedly occurred

title: Are you looking ahead?
lead: New year, new challenges and particularly on immediate energy prices. However you need to be looking ahead to secure the best prices right now.  Listen to the podcast episode to find out.

title: Almost 10m jobs in carbon-intensive industries in the UK ‘will be disrupted by 2050’
lead: Almost 52% of these high-emitting jobs are concentrated in the North, the Midlands or Scotland, according to new research

title: South Korea to replace all diesel passenger trains with low carbon high-speed alternatives by 2029
lead: The move is predicted to slash almost 30% of the carbon footprint of the trains used at the moment and reduce greenhouse gas emissions by 70,000 tonnes
